definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.chinese: 某种类型的湿的幕后故事，耳朵背包客？

sentences.english: We are a group of backpackers.
Chengdu is a backpacker’s paradise as well as the business gateway to Western China.
sentences.chinese: 成都不但是中国西部的商业关口，还是背包客的天堂。

sentences.english: A female backpacker from Newcastle slips on to one of the four couches arranged around the table.
sentences.chinese: 一位来自纽卡素的女背包客滑进了桌旁的沙发。

sentences.english: Backpackers are thought of as young people, although that is not always true.
sentences.chinese: 通常认为背包客都是年轻人，但事实并不都是如此。

sentences.english: And I always worry about the tourists who backpack around China.
sentences.chinese: 我经常担心那些在中国旅游的背包客。

sentences.english: It is common for Asian backpackers going to language school.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲背包客去语言学校念英文是很常见的事。

sentences.english: It's definitely out of range for most backpackers, myself included.
sentences.chinese: 这对于背包客来说是很难承受的，其中也包括我。
他是一个全职的背包客。

sentences.english: The old man took in the lost backpackers for the night.
sentences.chinese: 老人收留迷路的背包客在家里过夜。

sentences.english: Two hikers are picnicking when a bear appears.
sentences.chinese: 两名背包客正在享受野餐，一只熊出现了。

sentences.english: The foreign back-packer loves traveling the world.
sentences.chinese: 那个外国背包客喜欢周游世界。

definition: youth hostel/abbr. for 青年旅舍[qing1 nian2 lu:3 she4]
to travel around (the world, a country etc)
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
